sources.data_found: We have three types GPU nodes available, with a total of 135 general-purpose GPUs, listed in a table below.
15 NVIDIA A100 80gb PCIe GPUs, 6 NVIDIA A10 GPUs, and 2 NVIDIA M10 GPUs
2 Quanta Cloud S76 nodes with NVIDIA Grace Hopper Superchip, Grace CPU, Hopper GPU processors, 480 GB RAM, and 10 GB interfaces
In 2023, 27,364 students were enrolled at University of Connecticut. The total enrollment at University of Connecticut in 2023, both undergraduate and graduate, is 27,364 students.

The most specialized majors at University of Connecticut are Math & Statistics (341 degrees awarded), Natural Resources & Conservation (179 degrees), Engineering (865 degrees), Social Sciences (804 degrees), and Agriculture (191 degrees) (as of 2023).

student_data.notes: Exact CS enrollment figures not found in available sources. Estimates based on: 1) 865 engineering degrees awarded in 2023, 2) typical CS programs representing 15-20% of engineering enrollment, 3) total enrollment of 27,364 students with approximately 73% undergrad/27% grad split. Estimates calculated as: undergrad CS ~650, MS CS ~200, PhD CS ~100.

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: 6 NVIDIA A10 GPUs at UConn Health HPC Facility
2 NVIDIA M10 GPUs at UConn Health HPC Facility

gpu_resources.notes:
CALCULATIONS:

1) Storrs HPC: 135 general-purpose GPUs (specific models not detailed on public pages)

2) UConn Health (Farmington) HPC:
   - 15 NVIDIA A100 80GB PCIe GPUs
   - 6 NVIDIA A10 GPUs
   - 2 NVIDIA M10 GPUs
   - 2 Quanta Cloud S76 nodes with NVIDIA Grace Hopper Superchip (counted as 2 GH200)

Total confirmed high-end GPUs: 15 A100 80GB + 2 GH200 + 8 other GPUs (A10/M10) = 25 GPUs

Note: The 135 GPUs at Storrs campus likely include various models, but specific breakdown not available in public documentation.

analysis_notes: Data collected from UConn HPC websites and DataUSA. GPU counts are partial - full specifications for Storrs campus 135 GPUs not publicly available. Student counts estimated from degree completion data.
